title: Solving Large Numbers in Python
excerpt_seperator: <!--more-->
published: true
---

Numbers can be extremely large. There was one equation, though, and I couldn't solve it using the normal methods. It was too large for my scientific calculator, which said OVERFLOW ERROR. Too large for Google, which said Infinity.
The equation was
<p align="center">
  <img src="https://awesometech10.github.io/images/mathmaticalexpression.png"/>
</p>

<!--more-->

### Infinity

If you type this exact equation into Google Calculator, the answer is Infinity. If you type this into a scientific calculator, you get an overflow error. All online websites that have the ability to do a similar equation couldn't solve it, so what could?
Python.
Python 3.4, to be exact.

### How I Solved this Number
Python could solve this number. If you know how to enter it.

Opening Python, I immediately typed in the equation. 
```bash
>>> (3)**(-7*(-24))**2
```

Amazingly enough, it worked. The answer was so large, but it was an answer. It's not infinity.



Large numbers can be solved. Using Python3.
